intro: Pedicularis quxiangensis, commonly known as the Qixiang lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The species is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers, which are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
